title: TRACTOR BUYER'S GUIDE: WHAT TO BUY WHAT TO AVOID?

subtasks: Check loader attachments (bucket, forks, grapple)
Install third function or diverter outlets for front-end loader accessories
Consider mechanical self-leveling loader for better control
Investigate rear remote hydraulic functions for attachments
Upgrade seat suspension for comfort (air ride seat)
Select appropriate tires (R14, R1 Ag, R3 Turf, R4 Industrial patterns)
Install liquid ballast in tires for enhanced traction and stability
Evaluate rear remotes and mid-remotes for additional hydraulic functions
Research factory cab options for climate control and safety

tasks.task: PHYSICAL TASKS AROUND FARM EQUIPMENT MAINTENANCE OR OPERATIVE ACTIONS
subtasks: Routine inspection and cleaning of farm machinery
Proper tire pressure and tread depth checks
Securing of safety features such as liquid ballast and rear remotes
Pre-use safety checks before operating tractors and attachments
Implementing appropriate adjustments for attachment usage (e.g., loader settings)
Operating front-end loader arm movements (lifting, lowering, rotating)
Positioning and operation of grapple jaws on front-end loader
Managing hydraulic functions for attachments (e.g., curl roll, third function, fourth function)
Engaging rear remotes for additional hydraulic system operations
Utilizing factory cabs for comfort and climate control during operation
Compare tractor models (e.g., 4066, 5065E, 4 Series, 5 Series)
Consider previous owner's experience and advise on tractor selection (e.g., 3033R upgrade to 4044R or 4052R)
Research and recommend standard features (skidster quick attach, third function, self-leveling loader)
Assess additional costs for optional features (mirrors, air ride seat, rear remotes)
Evaluate factory cab benefits versus open station tractors
Monitor industry trends in agricultural equipment (e.g., upsurge in tractor sales)
Consider the influence of media on economic perceptions (diametral between doom and gloom and strong demand)
Stay informed about dealer rollouts and service availability (Summit Tractors controlled rollout stages)
